FuncDef:
The maximum load-balancing command configures the maximum number of equal-cost routes for load balancing.
The undo maximum load-balancing command restores the default configuration.
By default, load balancing is supported, and a maximum of 64 equal-cost routes can load-balance traffic.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of equal-cost routes that can load-balance traffic.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 64.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the maximum number of equal-cost routes for load balancing, run the maximum load-balancing command. Bear memory capacity in mind when configuring the number.
Configuration Impact
If the command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
